metadata.Title: CVE-2014-1921 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
parcimonie before 0.8.1, when using a large keyring, sleeps for the same amount of time between fetches, which allows attackers to correlate key fetches via unspecified vectors.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-1921` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

parcimonie - 0.8.2-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: parcimonie package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.8.2-1').
